isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LUBRICATION AND SEALERS - LUBRICATION INTERVALS GUIDE - SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS

step2.para: For Engine Oil Specifications refer to , Engine Oil Specifications, (except Diesel Engines not manufactured by International. This information will be found in separate engine supplements furnished with vehicle.).
Recommended Engine Oil and Oil Filter Service Intervals for diesel engines not manufactured by International will be located in a separate manual furnished with vehicle.
Diesel Engines; When air restriction reading (in inches of water vacuum) reaches the level shown in the table, replace engine air cleaner.

Due to the many variables associated with element washing, only new air cleaner elements should be used to replace elements that have become restricted beyond the maximum recommended restriction level. These elements are not to be cleaned. Replacement of elements is not to be judged on appearance, but by the air restriction.

Spicer ( Figure 10)
- Multipurpose EP gear lubricant of API GL-5 quality meeting MlL-L-2105D specifications including synthetic lubricants. The following table indicates which SAE viscosities are recommended for the temperature ranges the vehicle will encounter. For abnormally high temperatures and/or severe service (hot climate prolonged periods), use SAE 140.
Recommended lubricant change intervals are dependent on the application and operating environment. The following chart should be used to establish proper change intervals.

entry.para: * Severe Service includes any applications operating at or near maximum GVW or GVW ratings, normally wet or dusty environment, or consistent high load and low speed application.

** Includes Semi-Synthetic blends that meet MIL-L-2105D. Synthetic lube used at factory is Emery Emgard 75W-90. Axles filled with synthetic lube will have a tag attached to the fill plug that reads as follows: "Filled with synthetic lube. Do Not Mix."

step2.para: SUBMERSIONIn the event the axle assembly should become submerged in water over the housing vent, it is recommended that the lubricant be checked for contamination. If water is detected, wheel bearings, hub cavities, and internal components must be inspected.

AFTER OVERHAUL OR CHANGE INTERVALSFill the axle assembly with specified lubricant to the proper operating level. Following an overhaul, the lubricant level must be checked and refilled after 24 hours of operation. This procedure is necessary to replenish the small amount of lubricant that's retained in the internal cavities and wheel ends during initial operation of the axle assembly.
Rockwell front or rear axle lubricant change after initial fill lubricant change is as follows: Vehicles operated less than 60,000 miles or 97,000 kilometers per year - change lubricant twice a year.
Vehicles operated more than 60,000 miles or 97,000 kilometers per year - change lubricant every 25,000 to 30,000 miles or every 40,000 to 48,000 kilometers.

The initial drain between 3,000 and 5,000 miles has been eliminated on axles filled with synthetic lube. Drain interval is extended from 100,000 miles with mineral lube to 250,000 miles with synthetic lube.
Synthetic lube used at the factory is Emery Emgard 75W-90. Axles filled with synthetic lube will have a tag attached to the fill plug that reads as follows: "Filled with synthetic lube. Do Not Mix."

entry.para: There is no upper limit on these outside temperatures, but the axle sump must never exceed 250°F (121°C).

step2.para: Eaton

entry.para: * Approved Petroleum Based Lubricant - Gear lubricants acceptable under Military Specification MIL-L-2105D.
.** Synthetic Approved Lubricant - Premium quality 75W-90 and 80W-140 SAE grade synthetic lubricants that meets or exceeds the requirements of MIL-L-2105D.

step2.para: The use of separate oil additives and/or friction modifiers are not approved for use in Eaton Drive Axles.
Limited slip additive is no longer required. Today's gear lubes (mineral and synthetic) have additives that will protect limited slip clutch packs.
Synthetic lube used at the factory is Emery Emgard 75W-90. Axles filled with synthetic lube will have a tag attached to the fill plug that reads as follows: "Filled with synthetic lube. Do Not Mix."

para.emph: Sheppard and Ross Power Steering Gears:

step2.para: Use Power Steering Fluid for all 1000 through 8000 Series, 9600 and 9700 model vehicles. Use 15W-40 motor oil in all 5000, 9200, 9300 and 9400 model vehicles.

para.emph: Bleeding Sheppard and Ross Power Steering

step2.para: Refer to GROUP 05 -STEERING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for bleeding procedures for the type steering gear being serviced.

All Dana Axles and Rockwell Axles with Easy Steer Front Axles. With chassis load on axle, force grease through thrust bearings. Then with axle lifted clear of floor, force grease between king pin and bushing surfaces. Use Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease.
Rockwell King Pins with Sealed Front Axles (02ARA) - Lubricate with vehicle on ground.

entry.para: MIL-L2105B Extreme Pressure Oil, except sulfurchlorine-lead type***
SPECIAL RECOMMENDATIONS For extreme cold weather where temperature is consistently below 0°F
* Heavy-Duty Engine Oil - Make sure to specify heavy duty type meeting MIL-L-2104B
** Mineral Oil inhibits against corrosion, oxidation and foam.

***Extreme Pressures Oils under some conditions might form carbon deposits on gears, shafts and bearings which will result in transfer case malfunctions and premature wear. It is suggested that if these conditions exist, and extreme pressure oil is used, change to mineral gear oil or heavy-duty engine oil as recommended.
Eaton®, Roadranger® Synthetic CD-50 Transmission Fluid
Engine Oil API-SF, SG or API-CD CE (MIL-L-2104D or E or MIL-L-46152 D or E)
Mineral Gear Oil API-GL-1 (Rust & Oxidation Inhibited)

step2.para: Do not use oil additives or friction modifiers.
Mild EP gear oil or multi-purpose gear oil are not recommended when lubricant operating temperatures are above 230°F (100°C).
Synthetic CD50 should be used when lubrication operating temperatures frequently exceed 250°F (120°C). Intermittent transmission oil temperatures to 300°F (149°C) will not harm the transmission.

table.title: Fuller Transmission - CD50 Synthetic Lube Chart

entry.para: Check Fluid Level. Check for Leaks.
Inspect fluid level. Check for leaks
Change transmission fluid where severe dirt conditions exist.
Inspect lubricant level. Check for leaks.
Change transmission lubricant on new units.
Inspect lubricant level. Check for leaks.
Change transmission lubricant where severe dirt conditions exist.

step2.para: Rockwell

entry.para: Heavy-Duty Engine Oil MIL-L2104B, C, or D or API-SF or API-CD(Previous API Designations Acceptable)*
Mineral Gear Oil with Rust and Oxidation Inhibitor API-GL-1*
* Multi-weight and EP gear oils are not recommended.

step2.para: Synthetic lube used at the factory is Emery Emgard 75W-90. Axles filled with synthetic lube will have a tag attached to the fill plug that reads as follows: "Filled with synthetic lube. Do Not Mix."

The initial drain at 5,000 miles can be eliminated on all vehicles built after March 1, 1993, with non-synthetic lube, except axle codes 14345, 14465, 14ERA, 14ERB, 14GRE, 14GRG, 14GRH, 14GRJ, 14GRK, 14GRL, 14GRM, 14GSC and 14GST which require the initial drain.
International/Spicer Transmission

entry.para: Synthetic Engine Oil Meeting MIL-L-2104D or MIL-L-46152B, API-SF or API-CD
Engine Oil API-SF, SG or API-CD (MIL-L-2104D or MIL-L-46152B) (MIL-L-2104B&C, or 46152 are also accpetable)
Mineral Gear Oil API-GL-1 (Rust & Oxidation Inhibited)
Synchronized Transmissions (lubricants are listed in order of preference).

step2.para: Do not use extreme pressure additives, such as found in multi-purpose or rear axle type lubricants. These additives are not required in Spicer Transmissions, and may in some cases create transmission problems. Multi-purpose oils, as a group, have relatively poor oxidation stability, a high rate of sludge formation and a greater tendency to react on or corrode the bronze parts in Spicer Synchronized Transmissions.
Non-Synchronized Transmissions (lubricants are listed in order of preference).
Synthetic lube used at the factory is Emery Emgard 75W-90. Axles filled with synthetic lube will have a tag attached to the fill plug that reads as follows: "Filled with synthetic lube. Do Not Mix."

entry.para: Synthetic Engine Oil Meeting MIL-L-2104D or MIL-L-46152B, API-SF or API-CD
Heavy Duty Engine Oil Meeting MIL-L-2104D or MIL-L-46152B, API-SF, or API-CD (MIL-L-2104B&C, or 46152-B are also accpetable)
Straight Mineral Gear Oil R&O Type API-GL-1 *Mild EP Gear Oil MIL-L-2105D or API-GL-5
*Synthetic Gear Oil Meeting MIL-L-2105D or API-GL-5
* EP Gear Oils are not recommended when lubricant operating temperatures are above 230°F (110°C).
Dexron® or Dexron II® Transmission Fluid Type C-4 (10W main case, 30W drop box).
Dexron® or Dexron II® Type C-4 Fluid
Use type C-4 SAE 30 in all applications where ambient temperature is consistently above 86°F (30°C).

Some Dexron® II fluids are also qualified as type C-4 oils and may be used in off-highway applications. However, a Dexron® fluid which is not a qualified type C-4 oil must never be used in off-highway applications. Consult your local Allison dealer or distributor to determine if a Dexron® II fluid is also a qualified type C-4 oil.

step2.para: Refer to separate Allison Transmission Operator's Manual for more lubrication details.

warning.para: When checking the oil level, be sure that the parking brake and/or emergency brakes are set and properly engaged, and the wheels are chocked. Unexpected and possibly sudden vehicle movement may occur if these precautions are not taken.

step2.para: Oil Check Procedure ( Figure 7)

Always clean around the end of the fill tube before removing the dipstick. Dirt or foreign matter must not be permitted to enter the oil system. It can cause valves to stick, cause undue wear of transmission parts, or clog passages.

note.para: Transmissions equipped with a transfer gear housing (drop box) contain two separate oil systems: the transmission system and the drop box system. Each system uses a different type of oil and must be checked independently.
Check for abnormal oil level, milky appearance or any trace of coolant in the oil.

step2.para: COLD CHECK

note.para: A cold oil check may be made when the sump temperature is 60-120°F (15-49°C).

item.para: Run the engine for at least 1 minute to clear the oil system of air.

With the engine running at idle and parked on a level spot, wipe the dipstick clean and check the oil level. Any level within the COLD RUN (60° - 120°F) band is satisfactory for operating the vehicle. If the level is not within the COLD RUN (60° - 120°F) band, add or drain oil as necessary to bring the level to the middle of the COLD RUN (60° - 120°F) band.

step2.para: HOT CHECK

note.para: If the transmission has reached normal operating temperature of 160-200°F (71-93°C), hot check must be made. The oil level rises as temperature increases.

item.para: Park the vehicle on a level spot, shift to (N) neutral and apply the parking brake. Let the engine run at idle speed.

Wipe the dipstick clean and check the oil level. The safe operating level is any level between the top of the cold run area and the hot full dot on the dipstick. If fluid is above the hot full dot, the transmission is over full.
If not within this range, add or drain oil as necessary to within the HOT RUN area.

step2.para: A grease fitting is provided to remove contaminants from the salt seal in the input shaft bearing cap cover. Add chassis grease WITH LOW PRESSURE when the vehicle is serviced. Use Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease or equivalent NLGI #2 Multi-purpose grease.

A grease fitting is provided at the output shaft dirt and water seal. The grease fitting should be serviced before and after winter WITH A LOW PRESSURE grease gun. Use Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease or equivalent NLGI #2 Multi-purpose grease.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Sheppard Power Steering Gears - Grease Fittings

step2.para: Spicer Front Driving Axles only - Lubricate with Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease. Lube axle shaft U-joint whenever axle shafts are removed. Lube trunnion bearings when bearing caps are removed for service. No periodic lubrication is required.

Rockwell Codes: 02191, 02194, 02195, 02196, 02ERA, 02ERC, 02ERD, 02ERE and 02ERG axles, lubricate with Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease. Lube wheel bearings, steering knuckle bearings, steering U-joints and outer drive shaft seals. To lubricate U-joints, raise wheel off ground and rotate wheel so that grease fitting appears in lube access hole.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Lubrication Points - Front Drive Axles

step2.para: Fabco Codes: 02083 & 02EYB axles, lubricate with Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease. Lube steering knuckle bearings & steering U-joints.
Use RHEOLUBE 362 or equivalent. RHEOLUBE 362 is available from Eaton Corporation under part number 113741. RHEOLUBE 362 is manufactured by NYE Specialists Lubricants, New Bedford, Mass.

Multipurpose EP gear lubricant of API GL-5 quality meeting MlL-L-2105D specifications including synthetic lubricants. The table at the right indicates which SAE viscosities are recommended for the temperature ranges the vehicle will encounter. For abnormally high temperatures and/or severe service (hot climate prolonged periods), use SAE 140.

para.emph: Typical Automatic Slack Adjuster and Camshaft Lube Points ( Figure 11)

step2.para: Lubricate with Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease or equivalent NLGI #2 Multi-Purpose Lithium Grease. Grease automatic slack adjuster with low pressure grease gun.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Typical Automatic Slack Adjuster & Camshaft Lube Points

step2.para: A caution label has been added to the master cylinder (in addition to embossed wording in the master cylinder reservoir cover) noting that the brake system uses only brake fluid. Add fluids as follows:

item.para: Brake fluid ONLY to the master cylinder reservoir.
Power steering fluid only to the hydraulic pump reservoir, NOT THE MASTER CYLINDER.

step2.para: Lubricate with Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease or equivalent NLGI #2 Multi-Purpose Lithium Grease.

figure.caption: Figure 12. Typical Drag Link Installation - Grease Fittings

step2.para: Lubricate with Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease or equivalent NLGI #2 Multi-Purpose Lithium Grease.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Typical Center Bearing Installation - Lubrication Point

para.emph: Typical U-Joint, Typical Slip Joint ( Figure 14)

step2.para: Lubricate with Fleetrite® EP2 Moly Grease or equivalent NLGI #2 Multi-Purpose Lithium Grease.
